intro: Pimpinella mulanjensis, commonly known as the Mulanje cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the Malawi region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fruit is a dry, multi-seeded pod, and it is sometimes cultivated for its edible seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
